name: cement production, type general use | cement, type general use | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20934/documentation

The dataset describes the production of cement type general use (uso general) according to technical norm NTC 121 (Icontec, 2014), which is based on the standard specification for hydraulic cement (ASTM standard n° C1157).;The weight composition of the cement is: 55% clinker, 2.2% gypsum, 14.3% blast funrace slag, 14.3% fly ash and 14.3% limestone (rounded numbers).;The cement density is 3g/ml and the resitance is 24-30MPa according to the NTC 220 (Cemex and Argos).

This activity starts with the reception of raw materials.

This activity ends with the cement produced in the cement mill. The dataset includes packaging in cement bags. No production waste is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume of 2016 is considered. Data from sustainability reports of 2014 to 2017 is used.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative production of cement type GU in Colombia. Data based from main cement producers and personal comunications with local experts.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Represent the current technology for cement production in Colombia.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The life cycle inventory model is based on the PCR for cement and concrete (Environdec, 2010), as well as on the LCA core model of the WBCSD-CSI EPD tool (Dauriat et al., 2014). Dauriat, A., Porté, C., Delerce, C., Guignard, C., & Adams, A. (2014). WBCSD CSI tool for EPDs of concrete and cement: LCA core model and database report. Environdec. (2010). Product category rules of UN CPC 3744 Cement.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is compiled based on different data sources, including sustainability reports, literature values and expert judgements. Most data is derived from sustainability reports of the three principal concrete producers of Colombia (Argos, Cemex and Holcim). The data is checked, completed and validated by local experts. In total, it is estimated that the data considered is representative for 81% of cement production in all the country (market share of the three main cement producers). Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total clinker production in mass. The amount of the exchanges were calculated considering the arithmetic [weighted] average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other Ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Refernce product with a density between 3-3.15 g/ml.

flow.name: cement, type general use
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

exchanges.description: Literature Value. 4% of gypsum per clinker mass is used according to the Colombian cement association, ASOCRETO. The mathematical relation used to calculate the value is: clinker*0.04* cement

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The cement used in the self-construction sector is typically packaged in kraft paper bags. The most common cement bags in Colombia weight 50 kg. The kraft paper weight is 92g/m2.
